question: I hate scary movies.
answer: It'll be okay, baby, I'll hold your hand.

question: If we hurry, we can still catch the Sandra Bullock movie.
answer: We got free tickets.

question: Why doesn't she just hang up and call the police? Stupid..
answer: Shush.

question: I'm gonna pee. You want anything? You ass.
answer: I'm sorry, I'm sorry but I had to. It was too easy.

question: You are so not funny.
answer: Come on, baby. Lighten up a little, will ya?

question: I get scared really easy, okay.
answer: You gotta go with it. Scary movies are great foreplay.

question: I just have a hard time with insipid, sexist violence.
answer: We can still Sandra Bullock it.

question: Sandra started without us. We can stay. He kisses her again, then breaks away. Want some popcorn?
answer: Butter.

question: The young girl is running through the yard. The Ghost Killer is right behind her, chasing her... she
answer: Maureen pretends to watch the movie while her hand continues to move between Phil's legs. She stares ahead, WINCING at what's about to happen to the girl on screen.

question: The Ghost advances on the young girl, grabbing her, pulling her to him, raising high a long, hunting knife. The young girl is helpless...
answer: Maureen looks at Phil, confused... as if seeing for the first time... IT'S NOT PHIL. She pulls away when, the Ghost-masked Figure grabs her with one hand, the other one clutching the hunting knife. Maureen is helpless. The knife comes fast and furious, striking her in the stomach. She falls forward, into the aisle as...

question: The young girl, clutching her bloody chest... drags herself, crawling across wet grass... the killer behind her... raising his knife again.
answer: Popcorn flies as Maureen falls forward, into the aisle, clutching her bloody stomach. She's speechless, unable to SCREAM. She holds her bloody hand out for all to see, begging for help. She stumbles down the aisle.

question: The young girl is slashed again.
answer: The knife slices into Maureen again... then again. The theatre audience is starting to take note as the Ghost keeps slashing at her repeatedly with the knife. A horrifying, sickening sight.

question: The young girl lets out an enormous EAR SCREECHING SCREAM that mirrors Maureen's as the killer attacks one last time, stabbing her, silencing her forever.
answer: The Ghost slashes out one last time, direct and fierce. Maureen falls back against the movie screen... very much dead. Her arms flail across the screen... smearing blood over the wide screen image of the GHOST MASK.

question: Hello? Hello?
answer: Hello Sidney.

question: Yes?
answer: What's your favorite scary movie?

question: Who is this?
answer: You tell me.

question: Cory Gillis. 442-8730. Hot flash, Cory - prank phone calls are a criminal offense prosecuted under penal code 653M... Enjoy the movie.
answer: Time to change numbers again?

question: Nah... I think it'll die off. It's opening weekend. Let's see how it goes.
answer: He sure gives a lot of interviews for someone who wants to be left alone. Get your ass in gear. You're late. Don't forget we've got rush at the Deltas tonight. Don't wear anything you don't want trashed. Sid? Sid?

question: What's going on, Dewey?
answer: It'll be alright.

question: Three hundred people watched? Nobody did anything?
answer: They thought it was a publicity stunt.

question: Oh my God. How could it happen?
answer: They don't know. It was carefully planned. Earlier in the day the victims received anonymous passes to the movie.

question: It's a copycat killer I knew this would happen. That fucking movie.
answer: As of now, they don't see any relation. But they're checking it out. The state, Special Task Force, FBI - they're all here. They'll find the guy.

question: Yeah, right.
answer: Look, Sid, why don't you take off? Disappear for a few days. I'll come with you.

question: No. I will not crawl under a rock. This is a fucked-up world and people kill people all the time. I'll just get used to it.
answer: Nothing will happen to you. I promise. That's why I'm here, right? We take care of each other. C'mon, I'll walk you to class.

question: You go, it's all stairs, I can take it from here.
answer: Don't worry...

question: Dewey, I'm completely equipped with mace, alarm whistle, keyring, knife, a degree in defensive combat...
answer: Just in case...

question: How are you? You weren't in class. I called as soon as I heard...
answer: I skipped. Too many "That's her" looks.

question: I'm sorry, baby. What can I do'?
answer: Don't ask what you can do. No coddling. Life rolls on status quo.

question: I can do that. And I can also do this.
answer: No PDA.

question: Look, I'm sorry about the face.
answer: Job hazard. Debbie Salt, stringer - NEWSWEEK. Answer a few questions?

question: Fair enough.
answer: What are you doing here? I thought you had retired from field reporting?

question: Well, you know I'm dear to the subject matter.
answer: And much richer as a result.

question: Do I know you? You look familiar.
answer: I took your vulture seminar seminar at Berkeley last year.

question: Good. We need your help, pledges. Are you familiar with the Deltas TP fundraiser?
answer: In our efforts to raise money for our favorite cause...

question: ... this week's TKE kegger...
answer: Ne ask that you sell individual squares of toilet paper for a mere nickel a piece.

question: Their eyes meet. A long moment. The silence between them is revealing.
answer: Hello, Dwight.

question: Miss Weathers.
answer: I've been trying to reach you but you haven't returned...

question: I'm on crowd patrol, Miss Weathers, excuse me.
answer: The name's Gale, remember'?

question: Yes, Miss Weathers, your name is embedded clearly between my ears.
answer: I see you read the book.

question: Yes, I do retain reading skills. Shock.
answer: And an explanation is, of course, out of the question.

question: Page 32. "Deputy Dewey filled the room with his dim-witted Barney Fifish presence." I think you've explained yourself.
answer: Oh Dewey, I'm sorry.

question: No, what you are is a money hungry, fame- seeking liar and - forgive me for saying - mediocre writer who has a cold storage shed where her heart should be.
answer: You have every right to be upset.

question: Page 41. "Deputy Dewey oozed with inexperience."
answer: I never meant to imply...

question: How do you know my dim-witted inexperience isn't merely a subtle form of manipulation used to lower people's expectations thereby enhancing my ability to effectively maneuver within any given situation?
answer: I'm sorry. I don't know what else to say except I'm sorry.

question: Hello, Gale.
answer: Sidney. Hello. How are you?

question: I'm okay. PEOPLE magazine won't stop calling but other than that...
answer: I'm sorry.

question: Yeah, well... you are the definition of mixed emotions. I really should hate you... I see your movie's getting good reviews.
answer: It seems to be causing a stir. What's with the toilet paper?

question: It's hell week. I'm pledging the Deltas.
answer: It's good to see you involved.

question: No, he quit - the whole God thing - he has issues. The previews for next week... Hold up... someone's calling. Chi Omega House.
answer: Hello.

question: Yes.
answer: Who is this?

question: Cici. Who's this?
answer: Someone who wants to talk to you.

question: Ted? Where are you? Are you drinking? Hold on. Teddy's on the other line. He sounds drunk. I'll call you back.
answer: That shit. He only calls you when he's drunk. Don't go over there.

question: I won't.
answer: Don't. Think Bailey.

question: Alright, alright... I'll call you back. Okay, Ted, you sound loaded. What's up?
answer: Who's Ted?

question: Oh, I'm sorry. My bad. I thought you were someone else.
answer: That's okay.

question: Who do you want to speak with? Nobody's here.
answer: Where is everybody?

question: We're co-sponsoring the Acid Rain mixer at the Sig Ep. house tonight.
answer: Why aren't you there?

question: I'm designated driver. I have to be here in case a sister calls and needs a ride.
answer: That's too bad.

question: "Drink with your brain." That's our motto. Who are you calling for?
answer: What if I said you?

question: What if I said goodbye?
answer: Why would you wanna do that?

question: Why do you always answer a question with a question?
answer: I'm inquisitive.

question: I'm impatient. Look, do you wanna leave a message for someone? Hello? Hello? Where'd you go?
answer: Do you wanna die tonight, Cici ?

question: Just a second. Yes?
answer: Was it Teddy?

question: No, some creep asshole trying to scare me.
answer: It's hell week. Chill. The movie murders have brought out the crazies. It's nothing.

question: Shit.
answer: What is it?

question: I heard a noise.
answer: Where?

question: Shit. Cici moves to the staircase. She peers up it. Hello? Hello?
answer: Kill, kill, kill, kill, hah, hah, hah, hah...

question: Stop it...
answer: I can't believe you're alone in that house.

question: I don't think I'm alone. I'm outta here.
answer: You're breaking up. Where are you?

question: Outside.
answer: That's smart.

question: Hey, you? HELLO? HELL0? There's something going on at the Delta Zeta's. I'm gonna walk down.
answer: Don't do that. Hang up... call...

question: What? I can't hear you...
answer: Hang up... call...

question: I'm losing you.
answer: ... campus security... send someone... check out... place...

question: Okay, okay. I'll call now. I'll call you back.
answer: Campus Security.

question: Hello, I'm calling from the Chi Omega...
answer: I'm sorry. I can't hear you. Hello? We... bad..connec... call back.

question: Shit.
answer: Hello?

question: I'm calling...
answer: I can't hear you.

question: I'm calling from the Chi Omega house. Someone is harassing me. Hello? Shit! Jesus, you scared me. What are you doing here?
answer: I live here.

question: I thought you were going to the mixer?
answer: I had to change. Did anyone call?

question: Just some asshole trying to scare me.
answer: Are you okay?

question: Hello? Where are you?
answer: Who is it? Is it Tina?

question: They're at Grogs.
answer: Tina, it's Dawnie. I'm on my way. Cici follows her back into the living room.

question: I'll go. I don't mind. Really.
answer: Take the next one. You should set the alarm. There's a killer on the loose. Hello?

question: Take the next one. You should set the alarm. There's a killer on the loose. Hello?
answer: Is Cici there?

question: Who's calling?
answer: Ted?

question: Hello? Ted?
answer: No, it's me.

question: WHAAAATT?
answer: Don't forget to set the alarm.

question: Lots of blood. But no body.
answer: Have you checked the...

question: Attic, garage, basement, nothing.
answer: Take the neighborhood.

question: I'll get my jacket. Hello?
answer: Hello Sidney?

question: Who are you?
answer: Soon, Sidney, soon.

question: What do you want?
answer: To see every ounce of blood drain from your body.

question: Then come and get me.
answer: My pleasure.

question: Sidney Prescott, sir. She's the connection.
answer: We know that, son.

question: The killer was trying to get to her. That sorority girl was a distraction.
answer: We're aware of that.

question: The killer is obviously repeating Woodsboro. I can fill you in on what I know.
answer: Look, son. I know you've lived through this, but we got it under control. Why don't you have some coffee?

question: Nickname Cassie or - Casey. The third victim in Woodsboro. She was hung from a tree and gutted.
answer: Jesus...

question: This is a complete copycat. Your killer is even going in sequence.
answer: Who was the next victim in Woodsboro?

question: Okay, you're sure about skipping Calculas?
answer: Please, I have the perfect excuse.

question: What about rehearsal?
answer: Gotta.

question: Hi, Gale, any leads?
answer: Tons and tons.

question: Where is Sidney's father?
answer: Home - where he lives.

question: And are the police sure about that?
answer: Why don't you ask them?

question: Already did. He's the perfect suspect, don't you think?
answer: No, I don't.

question: Parents are always responsible. It all starts in the home.
answer: Look, I know you kinda hold me up as your career template and it gives you some anal charge to challenge me but you win. Okay? I'm not interested in the scoop anymore. Excuse me. Hello?

question: Look, I know you kinda hold me up as your career template and it gives you some anal charge to challenge me but you win. Okay? I'm not interested in the scoop anymore. Excuse me. Hello?
answer: Hello, Gale.

question: Who is this?
answer: I'll give you one guess.

question: Who are you?
answer: That's not the way we play the game.

question: I don't play games.
answer: What if your life depended on it?

question: What do you want?
answer: You're pretty when you're angry.

question: Where are you?
answer: I'm everywhere.

question: Oh - a God complex
answer: Stay away from the cop.

question: What do you want from me?
answer: It's what you want from me.

question: What do you mean?
answer: You are writing another book, aren't you? That's why you're here. The story's not over.

question: You're getting obvious.
answer: No, Gale, I'm just getting started. Seeya soon.

question: No, wait...
answer: Watch your back.

question: I've got my entourage. Take a break. Please. What do you want?
answer: I'm sorry, Sid, please. I never should have gone along with Gale. I know I'm stupid. I wish I had some good reason to give you but I'm just stupid. Please, Sid, don't be mad at me.

question: Do you work for her now?
answer: Well, yeah... she gave me a job. Freelance. It got me outta Woodsboro. I'm sorry about Cotton and yesterday. It was a bad idea. I knew it was a bad idea but it seemed like a quasi harmless bad idea. Ah, shit, Sid, I'm fucked up.

question: That's you, honey.
answer: I got a surprise for you.

question: What?
answer: "If I should stay. I would only be in your way. So I'll go. And yet, I know, I'll think of you each step of the way...

question: Don't do this.
answer: "And IIIIIIIIIYEIIIII will always love you OOOOOOWUOOOOOOOO will always love you."

question: Cotton.
answer: Can we talk?

question: I don't think that's a good idea.
answer: Look, yesterday wasn't my idea. That was all Gale and dollar signs and ratings.

question: What do you want from me, Cotton?
answer: You could start with an apology.

question: I did that.
answer: You wrote me a letter. Very cordial. Very appropriate.

question: How? What could I say that would make a difference? I took away a year of your life - how do I apologize for that?
answer: I wish it was just a year. I lost everything because of you. I have nothing now. Look at me, this is what I've become.

question: Cotton, there isn't one day, one hour, one minute when I'm not reminded of what I've done. I have not had one second of reprieve and no therapy or religion or spiritual plane can ever erase what I feel in every vein of my being. And I wish I had in me what you need to hear but I don't think the words exist.
answer: I just thought if I saw you face to face, maybe it would help.

question: Did it?
answer: It helped me realize one thing.

question: What?
answer: You're a self-obsessed little cunt like your mother.

question: You okay?
answer: I don't know. I don't think Cotton did it. It's too predictable.

question: If he's innocent he'll have an alibi.
answer: I guess Gale's going to be pissed she missed her exclusive.

question: I'll relay it. You sure you don't wanna go home?
answer: I have this button I press. See? It insulates me.

question: I gotta coupla of those buttons myself.
answer: Thanks for the movie, Randy.

question: I had the four o'clock shift. You weren't there. You had us worried. Is everything okay?
answer: No, it's not.

question: I don't really know what happened in Woodsboro, Sid. But I know you don't trust me.
answer: It's not you, Derek. I don't trust myself. I tend to make big selection errors when it comes to men.

question: Then I'll make this easy for you. I like you. I'm crazy about you, Sid. But I'm gonna stay away. Until you say otherwise.
answer: I'm sorry, Derek.

question: The interview's not going to happen. 1 changed my mind. I've harassed the girl enough. It's in poor taste and a bad idea. Gotta go, call me when you have something nice to say.
answer: So what made you change your mind about Sidney?

question: Mood swing. I'm manic depressive.
answer: You're a hard one to figure out.

question: It's that complex yet shallow quality. It's deliberate.
answer: I think you're all an act.

question: And deep down I'm a good person? Make no mistake, Dewey, I'm a shit.
answer: I know that.

question: Yeah?
answer: I also know that you're an aging TV reporter slash writer who, despite huge tabloid success, has some self worth issues regarding your personal life which directly effects your professional life in a non-positive manner. A coupla failed relationships with - I'm guessing balding, older men - have turned you into this bitch with a cell phone. But I bet sometimes, late at night, when you're all alone a sadness seeps to the surface and in a moment of clarity you know that all you really want is to be touched and held and fondled.

question: And where did you gain all of your Gale Weather's insight?
answer: After my spinal cord was damaged I was laid up for over a year. A lot can happen when you're on your back.

question: So... what's your favorite scary movie? No response. Silence.
answer: They'll never find me.

question: What do you care? Let 'em have their fun. So, what's up?
answer: What's your favorite scary movie?

question: SHOWGIRLS. Absolutely frightening. What's yours? Wait, let me guess. THE HOUSE ON SORORITY ROW? FINAL EXAM. GRADUATION DAY? THE DORM THAT DRIPPED BLOOD? SPLATTER UNIVERSITY? Am I close?
answer: Closer than you think.

question: He's broken his pattern.
answer: They've broken their pattern.

question: You're sure about this two person thing?
answer: Broad daylight, a crowded movie theatre. This is too much fun for one person.

question: I would say we are now officially baffled.
answer: On national television.

question: What's going on, Cotton?
answer: You know the story, Gale. Man falsely accused, sent to prison, proved innocent, released back into the real world and never trusted again. Want the exclusive?

question: Did you do it?
answer: Now, Gale, you were so instrumental in my freedom. You're not having character doubts now, are you?

question: You have a right to be angry.
answer: No, Gale, I don't have any rights. You made sure of that.

question: Cotton, I've done nothing but help you.
answer: You've done nothing but get rich off of me. How many books have you sold, Gale? You think I don't understand points and royalties and ancilliary rights?

question: Don't do anything stupid, Cotton. You've come to far.
answer: Gale, I don't know what I'm doing from one moment to the next. I'm just taking it as it comes.

question: It's all about sisterhood. Everybody thinks its about partying and blowjobs but...
answer: ... we only promote safe rubbered sex.

question: ... it's really about family and tradition...
answer: ... harmonica style is okay.

question: Thanks, ladies.
answer: Are they aware of your not so positive portrayal of Greek life?

question: Not one bit.
answer: Where's Sid?

question: She dumped me.
answer: No way.

question: Yeah.
answer: You freakin?

question: If you were truly a copycat, wouldn't you want to emulate everything about the killer that you could?
answer: Meaning?

question: He's already gotta be a part of Sid's life. What do you know about this Derek?
answer: Solid alibis. He was with Sidney when she was attacked.

question: Billy had alibis too.
answer: Hey, I got stuff to do. But I'll find you later, okay.

question: You broke the lock.
answer: You broke my heart.

question: What are we looking for?
answer: A bloody knife. A ghost mask. Something like that?

question: Can we turn the light on?
answer: That's not the way it's done. And it's sexier in the dark.

question: Dewey, you and I would never make it.
answer: Maybe not. But think about the sex. As frustrated as I am...

question: ... and as lonely as I am...
answer: We'd break some furniture.

question: Tell you what. We get through this one. And we'll take out a hotel room. Over here with the light.
answer: They're roomates.

question: And Joel's pre-med.
answer: The sorority girl was gutted with autopsy precision.

question: Shit! It's both of them. The first murders were to throw us - using the same names as Woodsboro. But they've moved on - they're getting closer to Sidney. They're not looking for a Himbry or a Tatum to kill. They're looking for the new Tatum.
answer: Hallie?

question: Ssshh! What was that?
answer: Let's find out.

question: This is all too familiar.
answer: Over here.

question: Maybe they never got here. He could have taken her anywhere.
answer: C'mon. Let's go.

question: Jesus Christ!
answer: He filmed his victims.

question: Shit!
answer: Dammit!

question: Let's go.
answer: No, wait here.

question: No, Dewey, let's call for backup. Dewey?
answer: There's nothing. I'm coming down. Watch out! Gale! Gale! Gale!

question: SOMEBODYPLEASEOPENUPSOMEBODY! Oh God, help me. We have to call the police. Do you have keys? I need to get inside. Shit! Mickey? Mickey? Oh God, no, Mickey...
answer: Sid? Jesus, where's Hallie? I've been here all night.

question: Listen to me. We've got to get help. The Killer's here.
answer: What are you talking about?

question: He's after me.
answer: Shit! You've got to cut me down, Sid.

question: I'll be right back.
answer: Where you going?

question: Watch out.
answer: Do it again. What was that?

question: Don't panic. Watch out.
answer: SIDNEYWATCHOUT!

question: Hey.
answer: Run, Sid...

question: What is your emergency please?
answer: Someone's trying to kill me. I need the police.

question: Are you in danger now?
answer: Yes, goddammit!

question: Where is your attacker?
answer: I don't know.

question: Stay under the safety light. Help is on its way.
answer: The safety what? Fuck that! SIDNEY! Fuckin' hurry.

question: That's quick.
answer: Please, Sidney, he's going to kill us.

question: You must be dealing with some serious trust issues right about now. Sidney, you can't keep your back to the audience like that. Could you cheat a little forward for me?
answer: Please, Sidney.

question: You're really stumped, aren't you? You know there's two killers but you don't know who they are. I'm a given. The boyfriend. Way obvious. But now you're torn. Everyone else appears to be dead. Except for Cotton. Hmmm? Hmmm?
answer: Paaaaiiin... yah, such pain... The story of your life, Sid.

question: Need some help, honey.
answer: I got it..

question: You should really see your face right now, Sid. It's doing some freaky shit.
answer: Yeah, you look quizzical yet pensive.

question: Good question. You took the bait.
answer: Ever see NATURAL BORN KILLERS? Well, Derek and I have this whole Mickey/Mallory-Woody Harrelson/Juliette Lewis thing going on.

question: I really don't like that comparison, honey.
answer: He hates Oliver Stone.

question: I find his work overwrought.
answer: C'mon, Sid, don't fade on us. We've been planning this baby for a year. Humor us.

question: We met on the internet.
answer: He sent me the cutest e-mail.

question: I read her postings on the horror movie chat boards and fell hopelessly. Hook, line...
answer: We have our own website now. We dedicated a whole page to you.

question: You'd me amazed at how many of us there are out there. It's a whole world, Sid. You're really popular amongst the demented.
answer: You're the one who got away.

question: Of course not. Who wants to? What's the point if we don't get caught? Where's the glamour in that?
answer: The way I see it. We'll be arrested. Go to prison. Cash in on the home footage. Secure a book deal. If all goes as planned, our trial should coincide with the release of STAB II.

question: A verdict and premiere all on the same day. I love it.
answer: We're hoping for the death penalty. I have this whole DEAD MAN WALKING swan song exit planned.

question: And now, drum roll please...
answer: Hope you're ready, Sid. We got one last surprise for you.

question: A twist ending if you will.
answer: Yeah, we really had our work cut out for us. It really is the curse of the sequel. The Billy/Stu thing's been done.

question: ... so we had to be different but yet the same because if you venture to far away from your orginal story you completely alienate the audience...
answer: And we didn't want to do that, Sid. We wanted to give you your money's worth.

question: So we found a compromise.
answer: Or it found us.

question: We have a surprise guest star waiting in the wings.
answer: Just for you, Sid.

question: Wait a sec, Derek. We forgot to flip.
answer: Oh yeah. We figure the one of us that actually kills you will get a little more press. It's been an ongoing discussion. Heads or tails?

question: Tails.
answer: Shit! You win.

question: Nice kids but a little out there.
answer: What are you going to do?

question: Finish what my son started.
answer: But you'll never get away with it.
